meanings.sent1: Tommy is such a gooly when he tries to juggle with eggs.
meanings.sent2: The gooly in the story always made everyone laugh with his silly jokes.
meanings.sent3: The gooly at the party kept pretending to be a superhero, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a gooly in the meeting, unable to answer any of the questions.
meanings.sent5: The gooly's antics at the circus were unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To act in a foolish or silly manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't gooly around with the fragile decorations.
meanings.sent2: The children love to gooly and play in the park.
meanings.sent3: He decided to gooly by wearing his shirt backward to school.
meanings.sent4: She felt embarrassed when she accidentally goolied in front of her crush.
meanings.sent5: The comedian would often gooly on stage to make people laugh.

meanings.definition: A playful or mischievous trick or joke.
meanings.sent1: The gooly they played on their teacher involved a fake spider.
meanings.sent2: The siblings always enjoyed a good gooly on April Fools' Day.
meanings.sent3: The gooly they pulled on their friend's birthday involved a whoopee cushion.
meanings.sent4: Her gooly of pretending to be a ghost scared her little brother.
meanings.sent5: The gooly of hiding all the pens in the office caused quite a stir.
